Without more details of the complaints, it's hard to say.

The default configuration is fairly polite about waiting between 
requests, but there are two behaviors which can sometimes cause problems:

(1) Heritrix by default uses a hostname-centric politeness policy. If a 
site has a large number of hostnames that all resolve to the same 
machine, that one machine may see a far-larger number of concurrent 
fetches. When we notice this happening, we add special settings for the 
affected domain(s) which slow the crawler.

(2) By default, Heritrix tries any plausible relative-URI-like String 
found in certain form elements and Javascript. This does not result in 
rapid requests, but can result in a lot of 404's as invalid URIs are 
tried against a site. Toggling some of the settings in ExtractorHTML and 
ExtractorJS can stop Heritrix from trying these URIs -- eliminating many 
404s (at the cost of possibly missing some valid URIs).

With more specifics, I might be able to make more specific recommendations.

- Gordon @ IA
